header: Alphabet mulls expanding Fiber internet service to LA, Chicago
body:
(Reuters) - Alphabet Inc said it would consider bringing its Fiber internet service to Los Angeles and Chicago, the two biggest cities the tech giant has worked with so far for the super-fast web service.

The Google Fiber service, which promises Internet speeds of up to 1000 megabytes per second, is currently available in Kansas City; Austin, Texas and Provo, Utah.

Alphabet, formerly Google, is moving into a new corporate structure that will provide more visibility on projects such as Fiber.

header: BRIEF-Alphabet says exploring bringing Google Fiber to Los Angeles and Chicago
body:
* Says is exploring bringing google fiber to los angeles and chicago

* Says also exploring possibility of bringing google fiber to nine additional markets Further company coverage:
